channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Nicole Rust
item.description: Simple RNN models that capture neural network criticality / edge of chaos?I'd like to play around with simple (tutorial-like) recurrent neural network models that capture the phenomenon of criticality. Something like the smallest possible number of recurrently connected model neurons that can recapitulate phenomenon (like information processing peaks for intermediate coupling weights).Any leads?

item.title: Luiz Pessoa
item.description: What explains the rich exchange of information here on Masto? It's really a great community.It's a deafening silence over at Bluesky... And the other place is not for many people for obvious reasons.#neuroscience

item.title: Luiz Pessoa
item.description:
Non-determinism in classical (and quantum) physicsVery interesting talk by Nicolas Gisin suggesting that mathematical real numbers are really "random" (given they require infinite bits to be represented).Thought @NicoleCRust and other folks might like it.h/t @WiringtheBrain Better link:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Lx4u_96cAfc

item.title: Matteo Carandini
item.description:
A nice news article about "representational drift" in The Transmitter:
https://www.thetransmitter.org/learning/what-drifting-representations-reveal-about-the-brain/I wish they had interviewed Claudia Clopath too. She has very convincing evidence against representational drift in visual cortex (which she published in eLife).

item.title: Emeritus Prof Christopher May
item.description: 'A law that‚Äôs not publicly enforced may as well not exist. Only saints will comply with it. The rest ‚Äì the people we really want to comply with it ‚Äì won‚Äôt bother.If we want to drive tax evasion out of the corporate world, we don‚Äôt need new rules ‚Äì we just need to enforce the ones we have'!!!Dan Neidle on the news that #HMRC hasn't made one prosecution under a law interned to punish the facilitation of #taxevasion... #ruleoflaw #taxhttps://www.theguardian.com/business/2024/jan/20/a-tax-evasion-law-not-publicly-enforced-may-as-well-not-exist

item.title: The Transmitter
item.description: The Transmitter is officially on Mastodon! The Transmitter is a new publication for the neuroscience community that offers news and analysis of the field, written by journalists and scientists. Join us in our goal to become an essential resource for neuroscientists at all career stages, to help them stay current and to build connections. To read some of our latest stories, check out: https://bit.ly/3GHKqnC #introduction

item.title: Luiz Pessoa
item.description:
Can we control an entire distributed circuit in the brain? If not now, when?Neurotechniques can do amazing things. One can target a population in region A to track specific projections to region B, and then study the impact on B.How far beyond that can we already go? What is the most extreme example that you know of open- or closed-loop manipulation?#neuroscience
@cogneurophys

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Criticality supports cross-frequency cortical-thalamic information transfer during conscious states
https://doi.org/10.7554/eLife.86547
#neuroscience

item.title: Julie Fabre
item.description: The time it takes to publish can vary considerably between fields and journals. This can make it difficult, for instance, for funding bodies to evaluate different candidates strengths. Fill out this anonymous survey to help us quantify this. Results will be made publicly available. https://shorturl.at/hpYZ3

item.title: Andy Alexander
item.description: @NicoleCRust @MatteoCarandini @thetransmitter @eLife @avaskham a similar behavioral explanation for drift in hippocampal spatial tuning can be found in this paper from the yartsev lab https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-022-04560-0

item.title: The Transmitter
item.description: Russell Poldrack shares the vision behind open fMRI and how the community-supported @bidsstandard helps keep data accessible and useable. https://www.thetransmitter.org/open-neuroscience-and-data-sharing/simply-making-data-publicly-available-isnt-enough-we-need-to-make-it-easy-that-requires-community-buy-in/?utm_source=mastodon&utm_medium=org-social&utm_campaign=2024122-simply-making

item.title: :jan:‚Äç:abreath:‚Äç‚Äçüå¨:dandelion:
item.description:
There is only one true God and they are Entropy and Decay :dancing_mushroom: :mario_mushroom: :moomin_mushroom:
#MushroomsOfMastodon> Think long and hard before buying oyster #mushroom blocks to grow in your house. They are a very aggressive #fungi and not at all picky on what types of wood they will consume. If you have any moisture problems they will begin to eat your house. I see these posts constantly in my mushroom ID groups. I started collecting pictures to show people so they could see the dangers themselves. I have not noticed any warning labels of any kind on the packaging, so buyer beware. If you have your heart set on growing mushrooms in your kitchen then I recommend that you pick any kind besides oysters. Lion's mane, maitake, chestnuts or literally anything else beside oysters...unless you rent and don't like your landlord üòÜ
Source: https://www.facebook.com/100066986004312/posts/694630886113105/?mibextid=AQCFcj8imgClWYJ5

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description: Photographer trains rats to press a lever for food. It also snaps a photo. Photographer pretends rats are taking selfies. Sigh. NY Times reports this in the Science section. Another sigh.Our Rodent Selfies, Ourselves https://www.nytimes.com/2024/01/23/science/photography-rats-selfies.html?smid=nytcore-android-share
